speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: SCENE IV. The heath. Before a hovel.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Enter KING LEAR, KENT, and Fool

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Here is the place, my lord; good my lord, enter:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The tyranny of the open night's too rough

speaker: KENT
text_entry: For nature to endure.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Storm still

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let me alone.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Good my lord, enter here.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Wilt break my heart?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I had rather break mine own. Good my lord, enter.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou think'st 'tis much that this contentious storm

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Invades us to the skin: so 'tis to thee;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: But where the greater malady is fix'd,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The lesser is scarce felt. Thou'ldst shun a bear;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: But if thy flight lay toward the raging sea,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou'ldst meet the bear i' the mouth. When the

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: mind's free,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The body's delicate: the tempest in my mind

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Doth from my senses take all feeling else

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Save what beats there. Filial ingratitude!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Is it not as this mouth should tear this hand

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: For lifting food to't? But I will punish home:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, I will weep no more. In such a night

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To shut me out! Pour on; I will endure.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: In such a night as this! O Regan, Goneril!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Your old kind father, whose frank heart gave all,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, that way madness lies; let me shun that;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No more of that.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Good my lord, enter here.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Prithee, go in thyself: seek thine own ease:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: This tempest will not give me leave to ponder

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: On things would hurt me more. But I'll go in.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To the Fool

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: In, boy; go first. You houseless poverty,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Nay, get thee in. I'll pray, and then I'll sleep.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Fool goes in

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Poor naked wretches, whereso'er you are,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That bide the pelting of this pitiless storm,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How shall your houseless heads and unfed sides,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Your loop'd and window'd raggedness, defend you

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: From seasons such as these? O, I have ta'en

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Too little care of this! Take physic, pomp;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Expose thyself to feel what wretches feel,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That thou mayst shake the superflux to them,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And show the heavens more just.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: [Within]  Fathom and half, fathom and half! Poor Tom!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The Fool runs out from the hovel

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Come not in here, nuncle, here's a spirit

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Help me, help me!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Give me thy hand. Who's there?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: A spirit, a spirit: he says his name's poor Tom.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: What art thou that dost grumble there i' the straw?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Come forth.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Enter EDGAR disguised as a mad man

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Away! the foul fiend follows me!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Through the sharp hawthorn blows the cold wind.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hum! go to thy cold bed, and warm thee.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Hast thou given all to thy two daughters?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And art thou come to this?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Who gives any thing to poor Tom? whom the foul

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: fiend hath led through fire and through flame, and

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: through ford and whirlipool e'er bog and quagmire;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: that hath laid knives under his pillow, and halters

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: in his pew; set ratsbane by his porridge; made film

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: proud of heart, to ride on a bay trotting-horse over

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: four-inched bridges, to course his own shadow for a

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: traitor. Bless thy five wits! Tom's a-cold,--O, do

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: de, do de, do de. Bless thee from whirlwinds,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: star-blasting, and taking! Do poor Tom some

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: charity, whom the foul fiend vexes: there could I

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: have him now,--and there,--and there again, and there.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Storm still

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What, have his daughters brought him to this pass?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Couldst thou save nothing? Didst thou give them all?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Nay, he reserved a blanket, else we had been all shamed.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Now, all the plagues that in the pendulous air

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Hang fated o'er men's faults light on thy daughters!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: He hath no daughters, sir.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Death, traitor! nothing could have subdued nature

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To such a lowness but his unkind daughters.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Is it the fashion, that discarded fathers

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Should have thus little mercy on their flesh?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Judicious punishment! 'twas this flesh begot

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Those pelican daughters.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Pillicock sat on Pillicock-hill:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Halloo, halloo, loo, loo!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: This cold night will turn us all to fools and madmen.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Take heed o' the foul fiend: obey thy parents;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: keep thy word justly; swear not; commit not with

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: man's sworn spouse; set not thy sweet heart on proud

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: array. Tom's a-cold.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What hast thou been?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: A serving-man, proud in heart and mind; that curled

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: my hair; wore gloves in my cap; served the lust of

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: my mistress' heart, and did the act of darkness with

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: her; swore as many oaths as I spake words, and

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: broke them in the sweet face of heaven: one that

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: slept in the contriving of lust, and waked to do it:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: wine loved I deeply, dice dearly: and in woman

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: out-paramoured the Turk: false of heart, light of

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: ear, bloody of hand; hog in sloth, fox in stealth,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: wolf in greediness, dog in madness, lion in prey.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Let not the creaking of shoes nor the rustling of

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: silks betray thy poor heart to woman: keep thy foot

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: out of brothels, thy hand out of plackets, thy pen

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: from lenders' books, and defy the foul fiend.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Still through the hawthorn blows the cold wind:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Says suum, mun, ha, no, nonny.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Dolphin my boy, my boy, sessa! let him trot by.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Storm still

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why, thou wert better in thy grave than to answer

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: with thy uncovered body this extremity of the skies.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Is man no more than this? Consider him well. Thou

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: owest the worm no silk, the beast no hide, the sheep

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: no wool, the cat no perfume. Ha! here's three on

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: 's are sophisticated! Thou art the thing itself:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: unaccommodated man is no more but such a poor bare,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: forked animal as thou art. Off, off, you lendings!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: come unbutton here.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Tearing off his clothes

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Prithee, nuncle, be contented; 'tis a naughty night

speaker: Fool
text_entry: to swim in. Now a little fire in a wild field were

speaker: Fool
text_entry: like an old lecher's heart; a small spark, all the

speaker: Fool
text_entry: rest on's body cold. Look, here comes a walking fire.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER, with a torch

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: This is the foul fiend Flibbertigibbet: he begins

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: at curfew, and walks till the first cock; he gives

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: the web and the pin, squints the eye, and makes the

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: hare-lip; mildews the white wheat, and hurts the

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: poor creature of earth.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: S. Withold footed thrice the old;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: He met the night-mare, and her nine-fold;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Bid her alight,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And her troth plight,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And, aroint thee, witch, aroint thee!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: How fares your grace?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What's he?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Who's there? What is't you seek?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What are you there? Your names?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Poor Tom; that eats the swimming frog, the toad,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: the tadpole, the wall-newt and the water; that in

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: the fury of his heart, when the foul fiend rages,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: eats cow-dung for sallets; swallows the old rat and

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: the ditch-dog; drinks the green mantle of the

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: standing pool; who is whipped from tithing to

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: tithing, and stock- punished, and imprisoned; who

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: hath had three suits to his back, six shirts to his

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: body, horse to ride, and weapon to wear;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: But mice and rats, and such small deer,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Have been Tom's food for seven long year.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Beware my follower. Peace, Smulkin; peace, thou fiend!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What, hath your grace no better company?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The prince of darkness is a gentleman:

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Modo he's call'd, and Mahu.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Our flesh and blood is grown so vile, my lord,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: That it doth hate what gets it.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Poor Tom's a-cold.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Go in with me: my duty cannot suffer

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To obey in all your daughters' hard commands:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Though their injunction be to bar my doors,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And let this tyrannous night take hold upon you,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Yet have I ventured to come seek you out,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And bring you where both fire and food is ready.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: First let me talk with this philosopher.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What is the cause of thunder?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Good my lord, take his offer; go into the house.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I'll talk a word with this same learned Theban.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What is your study?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: How to prevent the fiend, and to kill vermin.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let me ask you one word in private.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Importune him once more to go, my lord;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: His wits begin to unsettle.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Canst thou blame him?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Storm still

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: His daughters seek his death: ah, that good Kent!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: He said it would be thus, poor banish'd man!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thou say'st the king grows mad; I'll tell thee, friend,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I am almost mad myself: I had a son,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now outlaw'd from my blood; he sought my life,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But lately, very late: I loved him, friend;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: No father his son dearer: truth to tell thee,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The grief hath crazed my wits. What a night's this!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I do beseech your grace,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, cry your mercy, sir.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Noble philosopher, your company.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Tom's a-cold.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In, fellow, there, into the hovel: keep thee warm.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Come let's in all.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: This way, my lord.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: With him;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will keep still with my philosopher.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Good my lord, soothe him; let him take the fellow.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Take him you on.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Sirrah, come on; go along with us.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Come, good Athenian.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: No words, no words: hush.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Child Rowland to the dark tower came,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: His word was still,--Fie, foh, and fum,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I smell the blood of a British man.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Exeunt
